overview_of_class:
Theories and intervention principles for disorders of oral language, reading, written language, mathematics, and nonverbal learning.
GENERAL OUTLINE AND UNITS OF THE COURSE
I. Definitions, principles of assessment, theoretical perspectives, and legal issues.
II. Approaches to instruction.
III. Disorders of oral language (listening and speaking).
IV. Disorders of reading (decoding and comprehension).
V. Disorders of written language.
VI. Disorders of mathematics.
VII. Nonverbal disabilities and social skills.
VIII. Approaches to progress monitoring and service delivery: implications for accommodations, instruction, and transition to higher education and the world of work.
IX. Long term outlook and prognosis, follow-up studies, psychosocial, educational, and vocational needs.
name: Diagnostic & Remedial Approaches for Children With Learning Problems
subject: CSD
